section.title: Add and Configure the Physical Infrastructure Provider
Adding Physical Infrastructure Providers
section.simpara: The Physical Infrastructure Provider extends CloudForms management capabilities for Physical Servers.

listitem.simpara: Log in to CloudForms Management Engine as a user who has permission to add providers. The default user is admin, password smartvm.
Navigate to Compute → Physical Infrastructure → Providers.
Click Configuration, then click Add a New Infrastructure Provider.
Enter a Name for the provider, for example, Physical Infrastructure Manager.
From the Type list, select Lenovo XClarity.
Accept the default Zone.
In the credentials area provide the following:
Enter the Hostname or IPV4 or IPV6 address of the machine where you installed the Physical Infra manager.
Enter API Port of the Physical infrastructure manager. The default is 443.
Enter the Username used to start the Physical infrastructure manager.
Enter the Password used to start the Physical Infrastructure manager.
Click Validate to confirm that the user has the proper credentials.
Click Add.

section.title: Discovering Physical Infrastructure Providers
section.simpara: ManageIQ provides the ability to discover all the Physical Infrastructure providers in determined subnet range.

listitem.simpara: Navigate to Compute → Physical Infrastructure → Providers.
Click Configuration, then click Discover Physical Infrastructure Providers.
The default Discover Type is Lenovo XClarity Administrator.
Enter the IP address range starting with From Address and ending with To Address.
Enter the Port.Click Start to begin the discovery process.

section.title: Refreshing Physical Infrastructure Providers
section.simpara: Refresh a Physical Infrastructure Provider to find other resources related to it and retrieve the latest data.

listitem.simpara: Navigate to Compute → Physical Infrastructure → Providers.
Select a Physical Infrastructure Provider to be refreshed.
Click Configuration, then click Refresh Relationships and Power States.
Click OK.

section.title: Removing Physical Infrastructure Providers
section.simpara: In order to delete a provider follow the steps bellow:

listitem.simpara: Navigate to Compute → Physical Infrastructure → Providers.
Select the Physical Infrastructure provider to be removed.
Click Configuration, then click Remove Infrastructure Providers from Inventory.
Click OK.

section.title: Editing a Physical Infrastructure Provider
section.simpara: In order to edit one or more Physical Infrastructure Providers, you have to:

listitem.simpara: Navigate to Compute > Physical Infrastructure > Providers.
Select the providers you want to edit from the list.
Click the Configuration button in the menu.
Click Edit selected infrastructure providers.
Make your changes and revalidate your credentials if necessary.
Click Save.

section.simpara: You should see a flash message confirming your changes were performed successfully.

section.title: Using the Topology Widget for Physical Infrastructure Providers
Viewing Host Relationships
section.simpara: You can view Host-associated Physical Servers that belong to the provider. In order to do that, you have to:

listitem.simpara: Navigate to Compute > Physical Infrastructure > Providers.
Click a Provider from the list.
Click Physical Servers with Host button in Relationships section.

section.simpara: You should see a list with the Host-associated Physical Servers.
